intro: Apodytes bequaertii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to parts of sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny leaves. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Apodytes bequaertii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
